Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: zebra, zébra, zebră, zebrā, zebrą, żebra, and žebra

Translingual

[edit]

Proper noun

[edit]

Zebra f

  1. (obsolete) A taxonomic genus within the family Equidae – now treated as a synonym of Equus.

English

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

Zebra

  1. (World War II era, joint US/RAF) radiotelephony clear-code word for the letter Z.
    Synonym: Zulu

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

    17th century, from Portuguese zebra, from Old Galician-Portuguese enzebro, ezebra, azebra (“wild ass”), from earlier cebrario (882), ezebrario (897), from Vulgar Latin *eciferus, from Latin equiferus (“wild ass”). Neuter gender probably after Pferd (“horse”).

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈtseːbʁa/
    • Audio:(file)
    • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
    • Audio (Austria):(file)

    Noun

    [edit]

    Zebra n (strong, genitive Zebras or (rare) Zebra, plural Zebras or (rare) Zebra)

    1. zebra

    Declension

    [edit]
    Declension of Zebra [neuter, strong]
    singular plural
    indef. def. noun def. noun
    nominative ein das Zebra die Zebras, Zebra
    genitive eines des Zebras, Zebra der Zebras, Zebra
    dative einem dem Zebra den Zebras, Zebra
    accusative ein das Zebra die Zebras, Zebra

    Derived terms

    [edit]
    • Bergzebra
    • Grevyzebra
    • NATO-Zebra
    • Steppenzebra

    Descendants

    [edit]
    • → Hunsrik: Zebra

    Further reading

    [edit]
    • “Zebra” in Duden online
    • “Zebra” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache

    Hunsrik

    [edit]

    Etymology

    [edit]
    Etymology tree
    Proto-Indo-European *h₁eḱ-
    Proto-Indo-European *h₁éḱwos
    Proto-Italic *ekwos
    Latin equus
    Proto-Indo-European *ǵʰwer-der.
    Proto-Italic *feros
    Latin ferus
    Latin equiferus
    Old Galician-Portuguese zevro
    Portuguese zebrabor.
    German Zebrabor.
    Hunsrik Zebra

      Borrowed from German Zebra.[1]

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • IPA(key): /ˈt͡seːpra/
      • Rhymes: -eːpra
      • Syllabification: Ze‧bra

      Noun

      [edit]

      Zebra f (plural Zebras)

      1. zebra (any equid of subgenus Hippotigris)

      References

      [edit]
      1. ^ Boll, Piter Kehoma (2021), “Zebra”, in Dicionário Hunsriqueano Riograndense–Português, 3rd edition (overall work in Portuguese), Ivoti: Riograndenser Hunsrickisch, page 179, column 2

      Italian

      [edit]

      Etymology

      [edit]

      (This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Zebra m or f by sense

      1. a surname

      Further reading

      [edit]
      • Stefano Ravara, Mappa dei Cognomi, 2015–2025

      [edit]

      Noun

      [edit]

      Zebra m (plural Zebraen)

      1. zebra
